member.name: P:ScottPlot.AxisLimits.NoLimits

member.name: T:ScottPlot.Control.ControlBackEnd
member.summary: The control back end module contains all the logic required to manage a mouse-interactive plot to display in a user control. However, this module contains no control-specific dependencies. User controls can instantiate this object, pass mouse and resize event information in, and have renders triggered using events.

member.name: E:ScottPlot.Control.ControlBackEnd.BitmapUpdated
member.summary: This event is invoked when an existing Bitmap is redrawn. e.g., after rendering following a click-drag-pan mouse event.

member.name: E:ScottPlot.Control.ControlBackEnd.BitmapChanged
member.summary: This event is invoked after a new Bitmap was created. e.g., after resizing the control, requiring a new Bitmap of a different size

member.name: E:ScottPlot.Control.ControlBackEnd.CursorChanged
member.summary: This event is invoked when the cursor is supposed to change. Cursor changes may be required when hovering over draggable plottable objects.

member.name: E:ScottPlot.Control.ControlBackEnd.AxesChanged
member.summary: This event is invoked when the axis limts change. This is typically the result of a pan or zoom operation.

member.name: E:ScottPlot.Control.ControlBackEnd.RightClicked
member.summary: This event is invoked when the user right-clicks the control with the mouse. It is typically used to deploy a context menu.

member.name: E:ScottPlot.Control.ControlBackEnd.PlottableDragged
member.summary: This event is invoked after the mouse moves while dragging a draggable plottable.

member.name: E:ScottPlot.Control.ControlBackEnd.PlottableDropped
member.summary: This event is invoked after the mouse moves while dragging a draggable plottable.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Control.ControlBackEnd.Configuration
member.summary: The control configuration object stores advanced customization and behavior settings for mouse-interactive plots.

member.summary: Current position of the mouse in pixels

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Control.ControlBackEnd.IsZoomingWithAlt

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Control.ControlBackEnd.Bmp
member.summary: The latest render is stored in this bitmap. New renders may be performed on this existing bitmap. When a new bitmap is created, this bitmap will be stored in OldBitmaps and eventually disposed.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Control.ControlBackEnd.OldBitmaps
member.summary: Bitmaps that are created are stored here so they can be kept track of and disposed properly when new bitmaps are created.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Control.ControlBackEnd.LimitsOnLastRender
member.summary: Store last render limits so new renders can know whether the axis limits have changed and decide whether to invoke the AxesChanged event or not.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Control.ControlBackEnd.PlottablesIdentifierAtLastRender
member.summary: Unique identifier of the plottables list that was last rendered. This value is used to determine if the plottables list was modified (requiring a re-render).

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Control.ControlBackEnd.currentlyRendering
member.summary: This is set to True while the render loop is running. This prevents multiple renders from occurring at the same time.

member.summary: Total number of renders performed. Note that at least one render occurs before the first request to measure the layout and calculate data area. This means the first render increments this number twice.

member.summary: Number of milliseconds after low quality scroll wheel zoom to re-render using high quality

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Control.Configuration.AllowDroppedFramesWhileDragging
member.summary: Permitting dropped frames makes interactive mouse manipulation feel faster

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Control.Configuration.UseRenderQueue
member.summary: If true, control interactions will be non-blocking and renders will occur after interactions. If false, control interactions will be blocking while renders are drawn.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Control.Configuration.IgnoreMouseDragDistance
member.summary: Distance (in pixels) the mouse can travel with a button held-down for it to be treated as a click (not a drag). A number slightly above zero allows middle-click to call AxisAuto() even if it was draged a few pixels by accident.

member.name: P:ScottPlot.Control.Configuration.WarnIfRenderNotCalledManually
member.summary: Now that the timer-based auto-render functionality has been removed users must manually call Render() at least once. This option controls whether a warning message is shown if the user did not call Render() manually.

member.name: P:ScottPlot.Control.Configuration.DpiStretch
member.summary: Control whether the plot should be stretched when DPI scaling is in use. Enabling stretching may result in blurry plots. Disabling stretching may results in plots with text that is too small.

member.name: P:ScottPlot.Control.Configuration.DpiStretchRatio
member.summary: DPI scaling ratio to use for plot size and mouse tracking. Will return 1.0 if is enabled.

member.name: E:ScottPlot.Control.Configuration.ScaleChanged
member.summary: This event is invoked whenever the display scale is changed.

member.name: M:ScottPlot.Control.Configuration.DpiMeasure
member.summary: Set the DpiStretchRatio to that of the active display. Call this if you suspect DPI scaling has changed.

member.name: T:ScottPlot.Control.DisplayScale
member.summary: This class detects and stores display scale. The scale ratio is used to calculate plot size and translate mouse coordinates to real pixel coordinates.

member.name: P:ScottPlot.Control.DisplayScale.SystemScaleRatio
member.summary: Scale ratio in use by the active display. This ratio is used when scaling is enabled.

member.name: P:ScottPlot.Control.DisplayScale.ManualScaleRatio
member.summary: Scale ratio to use if scaling is disabled.

member.name: P:ScottPlot.Control.DisplayScale.Enabled
member.summary: Control whether the plot bitmap should be stretched if display scaling is active. When enabled text will be large but may be blurry. When disabled text will be sharp but may be too small to read on high-resolution displays.

member.name: P:ScottPlot.Control.DisplayScale.ScaleRatio
member.summary: Current display scale ratio.

member.name: E:ScottPlot.Control.DisplayScale.ScaleChanged
member.summary: This event is invoked whenever the display scale is changed.

member.name: M:ScottPlot.Control.DisplayScale.Measure
member.summary: Update the scale ratio using that of the active display. Call this method if you expect the display scale has changed.

member.name: T:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.UIEventFactory

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.EventsProcessor.Queue
member.summary: List of events that have not yet been processed

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.EventsProcessor.Enable

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.EventsProcessor.RenderDelayTimer

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.EventsProcessor.QueueProcessorIsRunning
member.summary: This is true while the processor is processing events and/or waiting for a delayed render.

member.name: P:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.EventsProcessor.RenderDelayMilliseconds
member.summary: Time to wait after a low-quality render to invoke a high quality render

member.name: P:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.EventsProcessor.RenderAction
member.summary: When a render is required this Action will be invoked. Its argument indicates whether low quality should be used.

Milliseconds after low-quality render to re-render using high quality.

member.name: M:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.EventsProcessor.RenderHighQuality
member.summary: Perform a high quality render. Call this instead of the action itself because this has better-documented arguments.

member.name: M:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.EventsProcessor.RenderLowQuality
member.summary: Perform a low quality render. Call this instead of the action itself because this has better-documented arguments.

member.summary: Add an event to the queue and process it when it is ready. After all events are processed a render will be called automatically by the queue processor.

member.name: M:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.EventsProcessor.RenderPreview(ScottPlot.RenderType)
member.summary: Perform a low quality preview render if the render type allows it

member.name: M:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.EventsProcessor.RenderFinal(ScottPlot.RenderType)
member.summary: Perform a final high quality render if the render type allows it.
member.returns: Return False if the final render needs to happen later

member.name: M:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.EventsProcessor.RunQueueProcessor
member.summary: Process every event in the queue. A render will be executed after each event is processed. A slight delay will be added between queue checks.

member.name: T:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.Events.ApplyZoomRectangleEvent
member.summary: This event describes what happens when the mouse button is lifted after middle-click-dragging a rectangle to zoom into. The coordinates of that rectangle are calculated, and the plot's axis limits are adjusted accordingly.

member.name: T:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.Events.BenchmarkToggleEvent
member.summary: This event toggles visibility of the benchmark. This event is typically called after double-clicking the plot.

member.name: T:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.Events.MouseAxisAutoEvent
member.summary: This event calls AxisAuto() on all axes. This is typically called after middle-clicking.

member.name: T:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.Events.MouseMovedToZoomRectangle
member.summary: This event occurs when the user is actively middle-click-dragging to zoom. A zoom window is drawn on the screen, but axis limits have not yet been changed.

member.name: T:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.Events.MousePanEvent
member.summary: This event describes represents interactive panning. It is assume the plot has already been reset to the pre-mouse-interaction state, and processing of this event pans the plot on the axes according to the distance the mouse has moved. This is typically called on MouseMove events when the left button is held down.

member.name: T:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.Events.MouseScrollEvent
member.summary: This event describes a zoom operation performed by scrolling the mouse wheel.

member.name: T:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.Events.MouseUpClearRenderEvent
member.summary: This event is called after the mouse button is lifted (typically following panning and zooming). It assumes all the axis manipulation (panning/zooming) has already been performed, and the purpose of this event is only to request an immediate high quality render.

member.name: T:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.Events.MouseZoomEvent
member.summary: This event describes represents interactive zooming. It is assume the plot has already been reset to the pre-mouse-interaction state, and processing of this event zooms the plot on the axes according to the distance the mouse has moved. This is typically called on MouseMove events when the right button is held down.

member.name: T:ScottPlot.Control.EventProcess.Events.PlottableDragEvent
member.summary: This event describes what happens when a draggable plottable (like an axis line) has been moved from its initial position. This event places the plottable of interest at the current mouse position. This is typically called on MouseMove events while left-click-dragging a draggable plottable.

member.name: T:ScottPlot.Control.QualityConfiguration
member.summary: This class defines the quality to use for renders after different interactive events occur. Programmatically-triggered events typically use high quality mode (anti-aliasing enabled). Real-time mouse-interactive events like zooming and panning typically use low quality mode. It is possible to automatically render using high quality after a period of inactivity.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Control.QualityMode.Low
member.summary: Anti-aliasing always off

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Control.QualityMode.LowWhileDragging
member.summary: Anti-aliasing off while dragging (more responsive) but on otherwise

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Control.QualityMode.High
member.summary: Anti-aliasing always on

member.name: T:ScottPlot.EqualScaleMode
member.summary: Defines if/how axis scales (units per pixel) are matched between horizontal and vertical axes.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.EqualScaleMode.Disabled
member.summary: Horizontal and vertical axes can be scaled independently. Squares and circles may stretch to rectangles and ovals.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.EqualScaleMode.PreserveY
member.summary: Axis scales are locked so geometry of squares and circles is preserved. After axes are set, the vertical scale (units per pixel) is applied to the horizontal axis.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.EqualScaleMode.PreserveX
member.summary: Axis scales are locked so geometry of squares and circles is preserved. After axes are set, the horizontal scale (units per pixel) is applied to the vertical axis.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.EqualScaleMode.ZoomOut
member.summary: Axis scales are locked so geometry of squares and circles is preserved. After axes are set, the largest scale (most units per pixel) is applied to both axes. Apply the most zoomed-out scale to both axes.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.EqualScaleMode.PreserveLargest
member.summary: Apply the scale of the larger axis to both axes.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.EqualScaleMode.PreserveSmallest
member.summary: Apply the scale of the smaller axis to both axes.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.ImagePlacement.Inside

member.name: T:ScottPlot.RenderType
member.summary: Describes how a render should be performed with respect to quality. High quality enables anti-aliasing but is slower. Some options describe multiple renders, with or without a delay between them.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.RenderType.LowQuality
member.summary: Only render using low quality (anti-aliasing off)

member.name: F:ScottPlot.RenderType.HighQuality
member.summary: Only render using high quality (anti-aliasing on)

member.name: F:ScottPlot.RenderType.HighQualityDelayed
member.summary: Perform a high quality render after a delay. This is the best render type to use when resizing windows.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.RenderType.LowQualityThenHighQuality
member.summary: Render low quality and display it, then if no new render requests have been received immediately render a high quality version and display it. This is the best render option to use when requesting renders programmatically

member.name: F:ScottPlot.RenderType.LowQualityThenHighQualityDelayed
member.summary: Render low quality and display it, wait a small period of time for new render requests to arrive, and if no new requests have been received render a high quality version and display it. This is the best render option to use for mouse interaction.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.RenderType.ProcessMouseEventsOnly
member.summary: Process mouse events only (pan, zoom, etc) and do not render graphics on a Bitmap, then if no new requests have been received render using the last-used render type.

member.name: T:ScottPlot.Plottable.PopulationPlot
member.summary: Population plots are designed to show collections of data. A Population is a 1D array of values, and statistics are calculated automatically. Populations can be displayed as bar plots, box plots, or scatter plots. Public methods, fields, and properties allow extensive customization. This plottable supports higher-order grouping (groups of groups).

member.name: T:ScottPlot.Plottable.RadarPlot
member.summary:
A radar chart is a graphical method of displaying multivariate data in the form of a two-dimensional chart of three or more quantitative variables represented on axes starting from the same point.
Data is managed using 2D arrays where groups (colored shapes) are rows and categories (arms of the web) are columns.

member.summary: Values for every group (rows) and category (columns) normalized from 0 to 1.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Plottable.RadarPlot.CategoryLabels
member.summary: Labels for each category. Length must be equal to the number of columns (categories) in the original data.
member.remarks: If showing icons, labels will be ignored.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Plottable.RadarPlot.CategoryImages
member.summary: Icons for each category. Length must be equal to the number of columns (categories) in the original data.
member.remarks: If showing icons, labels will be ignored.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Plottable.RadarPlot.GroupLabels
member.summary: Labels for each group. Length must be equal to the number of rows (groups) in the original data.

member.summary: A radial gauge chart is a graphical method of displaying scalar data in the form of a chart made of circular gauges so that each scalar is represented by each gauge.

member.summary: This array holds the original levels passed-in by the user. These levels are used to calculate radial gauge positions on every render.

member.summary: Number of gauges.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Plottable.RadialGaugePlot.MaximumAngle
member.summary: Maximum size (degrees) for the gauge. 180 is a semicircle and 360 is a full circle.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Plottable.RadialGaugePlot.CircularBackground
member.summary: Controls whether the backgrounds of the gauges are full circles or stop at the maximum angle.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Plottable.RadialGaugePlot.Labels
member.summary: Labels that appear in the legend for each gauge. Number of labels must equal number of gauges. May be null if gauges are not to appear in the legend.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Plottable.RadialGaugePlot.Colors
member.summary: Colors for each gauge. Number of colors must equal number of gauges.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Plottable.RadialGaugePlot.BackgroundTransparencyFraction
member.summary: Describes how transparent the unfilled background of each gauge is (0 to 1). The larger the number the darker the background becomes.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Plottable.RadialGaugePlot.Clockwise
member.summary: Indicates whether gauges fill clockwise as levels increase. If false, gauges will fill counter-clockwise (anti-clockwise).

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Plottable.RadialGaugePlot.GaugeMode
member.summary: Determines whether the gauges are drawn stacked (dafault value), sequentially, or as a single gauge (ressembling a pie plot).

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Plottable.RadialGaugePlot.OrderInsideOut
member.summary: Controls whether gauges will be dwan inside-out (true) or outside-in (false)

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Plottable.RadialGaugePlot.LabelPositionFraction
member.summary: Defines where the gauge label is written on the gage as a fraction of its length. Low values place the label near the base and high values place the label at its tip.

member.name: F:ScottPlot.Plottable.RadialGaugePlot.StartingAngle
member.summary: Angle (degrees) at which the gauges start. 270 for North (default value), 0 for East, 90 for South, 180 for West, etc. Expected values in the range [0-360], otherwise unexpected side-effects might happen.

member.summary: Size of the gague label text as a fraction of the gauge width.

member.name: T:ScottPlot.Plottable.SignalPlotConst`1
member.summary: This plot type is a potentially faster version of the SignalPlot. It pre-calculates min/max values for various segments of data, greatly speeding-up rendering for extremely large datasets (10s of millions of points). Note that these pre-calculations require more memory and an up-front calculation delay. If the underlying data is updated, you must call Update() methods to recalculate the min/max values.

member.summary: Compute the histogram of a dataset.
member.param: Input data
Lower edge of the first bin (inclusive). If NaN, minimum of input values will be used.
High edge of the largest bin (inclusive). If NaN, maximum of input values will be used.
Width of each bin.

If False, the result will contain the number of samples in each bin. If True, the result is the value of the probability density function at the bin (the sum of all values will be 1 if the bin size is 1).

Lower edge of the first bin (inclusive). If NaN, minimum of input values will be used.
High edge of the largest bin (inclusive). If NaN, maximum of input values will be used.
